bookmark.title: Terminology Changes
bookmark.desc: XSLT makes a number of refinements to technology and a glossary is now available at the end of the specification.

bookmark.title: XHTML Output
bookmark.desc: XSLT 2.0 adds the xhtml output method - see section 5 of the serialization specification.

bookmark.title: Multiple Result Trees
bookmark.desc: One of the most welcome new features in XSLT 2.0 is the ability to produce multiple result trees within.

bookmark.title: Regular expressions
bookmark.desc: A regular expression describes text with a pattern made up of characters that have special meaning within the expression.

bookmark.title: array_diff_key
bookmark.desc: Returns an array that contains all of the values from the first array whose key are not present in any of the arrays provided.

bookmark.title: array_unique
bookmark.desc: creates and returns an array containing each element in the given array. if any values are duplicated, the later values are ignored.

bookmark.title: arsort
bookmark.desc: sorts and array in reverse order, maintaining the keys for the array values.

bookmark.title: Ceil
bookmark.desc: return the next highest value to number, rounding upwards if needed.

bookmark.title: chdir
bookmark.desc: sets the current working directory to path, returns true if the operation was successful and false if not.

bookmark.title: chroot
bookmark.desc: changes the root directory of the current process to path.

bookmark.title: connection_status
bookmark.desc: returns the status of the connection as a bit field with three states (Normal, Aborted, Time-out).

bookmark.title: current
bookmark.desc: returns the value of the element to which the internal pointer is set.

bookmark.title: dir
bookmark.desc: returns an instance of the directory class initialized to the given path.
